DOC.brief_title: Comparison Epidemiology Clinical Outcomes Influenza A & B Cases Manitoba , Canada
DOC.detailed_description: Annual epidemic influenza important public health problem globally Canada . Each year , 10-25 % Canadian population become infected influenza . Most infection typically asymptomatic associate mild self-limiting illness . However , influenza cause severe illness lead hospitalization death , especially among young , elderly among underlie chronic condition . It estimate average 4,000 influenza-related death occur Canada year . In addition , economic burden influenza significant high direct cost associate increased utilization service indirect cost cause school work absenteeism . This project compare laboratory-confirmed case influenza A B term epidemiology , overall cause-specific incidence rate important clinical outcome include physician visit , hospitalization death follow clinical diagnosis influenza case Manitoba period 1993 2008 . The study assess secular seasonal trend incidence rate influenza A B case Manitoba period 1993-2008 , determine whether rate vary different subset population define demographic ( e.g. , age group , gender ) , socioeconomic , geographic ( neighborhood residence ) clinical ( e.g. , vaccination , presence chronic condition , immune status ) characteristic . The analysis influenza type compare overall cause-specific incidence rate physician visit , hospitalization death follow diagnosis laboratory-confirmed influenza . The effect influenza type clinical outcome ( e.g. , hospitalization ) assess multivariate model account potential confounding demographic , socioeconomic , geographic clinical ( e.g. , co-morbidity , immune status ) characteristic .
